title: Club Class to Cancun
text:
Check in
• WOW in a word – never have we been in less of a line, with less hassle and greater efficiency in long time at Toronto International that is saying something – well done
• Check in at Cancun was equally as efficient and the process was smooth (though there were considerably more people)
Lounges
• Lounge access in both airports was nice. The Toronto lounge is known to us and was as expected however the lounge in Cancun leaves much to be desired. Food selection there was minimal, service poor and slow and the ladies working really seemed like the would rather be anywhere else than there – a miss for sure
Flights
• Excellent from start to finish in both directions
• Seats are comfortable, service was personalized and friendly
• Food was not the best or the worst airline food but it did the job
• In-flight films were current and in abundance
General
• We would definitely fly with class with Air Transat again – without hesitation, the only caveat being flights in duration of less than 5 hrs – I would not fly overseas without being able to fully recline to attempt sleep

title: Feb 11 -21 2020 - Valentine & Birthday trip for 2
text: Upon arrival we were ushered to our Serenity Club check-in and Jesus introduced himself and offered us a cold beverage! Lovely start. Our room was ready and we were escorted to our suite by Berto our 'butler' for the 10 days. He was charming, while we walked to our room, he shared information about the hotel, restaurants, pools etc. We selected a Luxury Collection - Serenity Club Jr. Suite Swim-out Ocean Front and were not disappointed! It looks just like the pictures on their web site. Spacious bathroom, King bed, couch, desk, mini fridge and wonderful deck/pool access! Would totally recommend that class of room as it was heavenly. Our first breakfast we tried the special Serenity Club - Vistas restaurant and were terrifically disappointed!! We waited 1 1/2 hr before we even got a beverage and that was incorrect - we are 2, we ordered 2 coffee/2 orange juice and were FINALLY served 1 of each. We left and never returned!!! We advised Berto of the issues and were advised that it would be passed along to management. Whilst we did notice an improved presence of mgr. and staff we also heard from other guests that the service had not really improved. I would suggest to the management that if they wish to 'sell' this as a value add that they truly improved the service. We noted that the server we had was moved to the buffet breakfast restaurant subsequently but that could just be a shift rotation. Regardless the breakfast at the buffet is excellent! The 2 ladies cooking omelets/eggs a la carte are charming and very skilled (rarely braking a yolk) plenty of variety and well presented/prepared! The Snack Shack by the quite pool was great for burgers/hot dogs, chips/salsa and even cievche!! Now if you are looking for an improvement on the usual buffet style dinners and are willing to dress appropriately - you are going to have a lovely time! Our favourite restaurant was Olios - quite, elegant and an excellent menu that, for the most part was very well executed. We dined there 4 of the 10 meals. I will share a sample of what you could be offered - fois grais, artichoke soup, duck breast. All excellent i only wish that the duck had been cooked consistently - I asked for medium rare and only once got it that way the other 2 times, well done. A shame really but I think that the 'wedding' groups impacted both kitchen and staff. Agua Bendita was fun and if you are willing to pay you can upgrade to a premium cut of beef. Satsu's sushi/maki was very good because the fish was so fresh. I would recommend for raw fish lovers to ask for the 'boat' which they don't really advertise but they will do for you if you order carefully. Vora Mar was great for lunch - amazing a la carte taco, pasta and wonderful fresh cold seafood as well as the regular items you should expect. Dinner was not as successful however. Over all I would say that there appears to be a significant effort made on sourcing and providing a superior food experience, well done! I would offer this with regard to purchasing wine - ensure you have what you list, we asked for an Italian Pinot on our first night and it was sold out - we never again asked. We would have had a bottle at every dinner so that is a loss for the hotel, additionally if you reduce your prices a bit on the wine and take less of a margin you would likely sell more to couples who are like minded. They advertise that a chef’s treat will be delivered daily – we got it only once! I would suggest you change the web site or ensure that you deliver on your promise. Pools are well maintained/huge, but we had our walk out and stayed there most days! The coffee shop in the lobby is terrific! Love that idea and it is very well executed! We enjoyed it very much. Bars are abundant, bartenders are very skilled with their mixology! Our only challenge was the overwhelming noise of the 'party' groups. Enjoy yourselves folks but not at the expense of everyone else! The gym was well appointed however it might be too small for those wanted to avail themselves. I tried and it was always busy – yes in the morning but that is when most folks want to exercise! We saw Berto our butler daily and he was very helpful in arranging my husband's golf round, making my birthday a very special day indeed and providing assistance/advice on everything when needed. I would like to thank him very much for his care/consideration during our stay! Overall I would highly recommend this resort to anyone seeking a break and cares for a more premium experience.

title: Great room, perfect location - staff needs improvement
text: Well, convenient is an understatement because within 2 minutes you are in the departures area of the airport! Room was well appointed and very quite, check in was efficient and well done. The lounge - well to say that they were less than efficient is an understatement - our drinks took forever to come and when we were hoping for a second we found, after 40 minutes of trying to get a server and then get the server to check on our order that the bartender had crumpled it up and thrown it away!!! We got a 'sorry' and 1/2 off those drinks but the manger didn't apologize and frankly he was more interested in talking with the waitress than watching the guests. Dinner was good, although before the shift change and the ladies joined I watched the server get bread for guests using his fingers (not washed/gloved or with a napkin) and place them in the bread basket. So glad we didn't eat the bread! Breakfast was included in our room rate and they let you know you are a second class citizen. You are directed (not escorted) the the back upper level and rather than giving you a linen napkin you are lucky to get cocktail paper napkins with which you are to wipe your mouth. Over all I would say that this could be a great property with staff improvements - hygiene/efficiency and courtesy but they have a monopoly for location. Be aware and you will manage fine .. but don't expect a 'great' experience.

title: Amazing
text: Take the time to enjoy the history as well as the beaches! This is a great visit and an amazing site. If you can, get a guide to help you to appreciate all you have too see!

title: Lovely hotel with great team but ... not location location location
text: Sadly this was a recommendation from travel professionals not my pick - the missing element for us was location! It was overlooking the caldera but sadly so far from both Fira and Oia - where you want to be. Rooms were very well appointed, we had an hot tub and our room was over the dinning room and it was very quite! Team was great, friendly check-in/out, bar and wait staff excellent! I would suggest that they could advise you of the hot cook a la carte options at breakfast which they did not do for us. We enjoyed our stay with you very much but I would recommend this for travellers looking to be 'away from it all'.

title: Wow...
text: Such an amazing place, wind, sea and the silence of the basin. Amazing to see the technological advances, well before the Romans, and how truly remarkable this culture was.....please visit. It is so worth the trip. Get a private guide, she made it so real - the museum and the curators are special. Thank you

title: I understand
text: This Church is there for a reason - we experienced some rather choppy water headed to Delos - so I appreciate and respect the love of family for those brave souls who went to sea!

title: Fun and vibrant
text: During your wandering, stop and look out to the sea and think of the centuries of fishermen who have braved the seas to feed their families. Smell the salt air and reflect!

title: Great Service ... food - average
text: Service was outstanding however the presentations were mediocre at best. There was no care to the presentations, it was just on the plate and the food lacked the finesse of the sister hotel restaurant Baos. Good but not great! Make a reservation at Baos!

title: Food, Service and Views - what else could want?
text: We were charmed by the team, lead by Giannis! So welcomed, pampered! We dined twice - trying the octopus, scallop appetizers and both the sole and fish for two for dinner. The food was excellently presented and very delicious. Sadly we had a mishap with one of our dinners - a kitchen malfunction and Giannis was quick to act. He explained the problem, which must have been very embarrassing but he handled it with such grace and aplomb we didn't mind a bit. We were whisked off to a sister property for dinner and he made it seamless! We had a lovely time with this team of people...all so charming and I can't say enough about the wonderful meals! If you have the opportunity - PLEASE dine with Giannis and his team at Baos!!!

title: Very traditional
text: If you are unfamiliar with Greek Orthodox Churches this is a great example .. rich, vibrant and so full of meaning. Beautiful

title: A quick stop to see history
text: Whilst wandering about the old town you will see the historic windmills .. take a picture! So pretty and once an economic staple for this island!

title: Fun and interesting
text: This is a lovely, picturesque part of the old town full of shops and great restaurants! Have a wonder, stop and enjoy. Relax you are on holiday!!

title: A little bit of heaven
text: A remarkable location just above the village! Greeted with such warmth - we felt welcome immediately! Our room was ready and so were we - Kynthos Junior Suite Rm #701 was our 'home' for the next 3 nights! So private, so quite and so well appointed! Luxury all the way. The pictures on the web site looked just like our suite! Breakfast was great - buffet but if you ask for eggs cooked differently or even pancakes, they will bring them happily. We were astonished that after only 1 visit to the dining room that the wonderful team knew our names/room # and treated us so kindly. This property is beautiful but what really makes this place special are the people supporting your vacation. The only thing that could be mentioned was that the bar is pool side and with the wind it can be a bit chilly, perhaps they could use the area below the buffet area for drinks before dinner? They are kind, friendly, gentle and so helpful without being prying or ever-present! We so enjoyed the pool side and the dinners in Baos were amazing. Please see my separate review for Baos - it is a GREAT place to dine! THE BEST!!! What more can be said about this remarkable place with spectacular view and oh so charming team members! Thank you for a truly lovely holiday - we hope to see you again!

title: Oh My Goodness
text: What can you say - the cradle of civilization, the birthplace of democracy we owe so much to so few! GO - see it .. experience it! Be amazed by it!

title: Delightful & oh so good!
text: JuJu was a delight. We dined there twice once having the sauté sea bass and the second time the Chateaubriand for two. Great value, great attention and care as well as service that was perfect. Try a gin martini - the bartender is excellent!

title: A Must See
text: Try to go early as the organized larger tours can really take over the site. You must go, you must experience the grandeur of this site. Truly remarkable. If you can get a private tour do so .. you learn so much more and can tailor it to your wants. Watch your step as the marble can be slick!

title: Bright and Bold
text: This is a fairly new building housing so many wonderful artifacts that it is hard to take it all in. We had 3 hrs there and just got the highlights. We did have a private tour guide with us and he was able to help our understanding and linked many of the sites seen above to the artifacts in the museum. I would highly recommend this as a stop on your tour!

title: The 1st stop on our Grecian Odyssey
text: The room was ready, early check in, with THANKS! We were greeted warmly and efficiently and escorted to our suite. We had a Premier Suite #563 and it was great! Two very distinct rooms with a couch, tv, desk, round table, coffee table before entering the ensuite bedroom with ample wardrobe space! (just like the picture on the web site) We had 4 nights to spend with the team at the Divani Caravel and we were not disappointed! There was one odd thing that I must attribute to the air quality in the rooms/hallways. I found that I would awaken dizzy and when out and about it would disappear but return in the night. I was not dehydrated and am not prone to vertigo. Just a friendly warning to sensitive travelers. Truly the team is what makes this property special .. we got to know Dimitris, Yannis and Giorgos & were delighted by their service. Thank you, gentlemen, for your care and attention. The buffet breakfast was ample and well presented. The hostess was prompt and friendly sadly the men working the buffet were not like the hostess. Food was very good; JuJu was a delight. We dined there twice once having the sauté sea bass and the second time the Chateaubriand for two. Great value, great attention and care as well as service that was perfect. We also dined at the roof top restaurant overlooking the Acropolis – you just can’t beat that view!! We even had entertainment when one overly enthusiastic diner decided to end his meal with a dip in the pool, fully clothed. The team handled it very well and everyone was safe! Such a lovely start to our adventure in Greece, thank you, we hope to see you again one day! (please accept my apology is I spelled your name incorrectly)

title: delicious sandwiches
text: Wow .. heritage ham/cheese and tuna on brown were delicious, fresh, filling and very reasonably priced. The cash process was quick and efficient and thank you to the lady on the cash for telling us about the ice tea! great value, great food and we will be back!

title: sushi lunch
text: We didn't want the grill and were taken to a lovely quite and intimate booth for 2. We had Sushi and Chirashi and both were fresh, well presented and delicious. We had tea with our lunch and were so satisfied! Thanks for a great meal. Your teppanyaki chefs were having fun with the children and it seemed like a great place for families! Service was prompt and efficient. Good food / good value!

title: Great evening - relaxed and delicious
text: We were welcomed to the restaurant and immediately taken to our table. We were given ample time to enjoy the cocktails we ordered before our meal began. We shared a Caesar salad and you have to ensure you eat the white anchovies, as they make the salad. We then had the wagyu tenderloins with wedge potato and mushrooms! Pricey but well worth the indulgence! Cooked perfectly and oh so tender. Service was friendly, efficient and professional. The only low spot was the coffee - it was just weak and terrible. We had a lovely time and will be back again!

title: Great location/great hotel
text: This is our third time staying at this property and we were not let down. Great location - walk to the state park/falls/maid of the mist or to the casino. Check in was efficient but the trainee didn't give us our breakfast chits or our water (Hilton membership). Bar is great fun, food on site which is very convenient! Rooms are well appointed, clean and large. The bathrooms have been refitted with large shower stalls and that is a PLUS!!! We did have one unplanned event - a 730ish fire alarm waking us up on Friday morning - but it was cleared quickly and back to normal. Love it here - thanks for another great stay!
place: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Niagara Falls New York

title: Must do .. but be prepared to get WET FEET!!!
text: OMG .. a must experience. Such awesome power and mother nature at her best! Great adventure, pick a warm day so you can wander the park after the ride to dry off .. your feet will be soaked! I have visited the falls many times but never did this - so don't wait like we did...do it now!!

title: Martini's at Parkway Prime
text: This is a great gathering place after a fun day exploring. Service is friendly and efficient but not intrusive. Bartenders are very good at what they do .. they know to stir a gin martini and not shake it! We enjoyed our converstaion with Milutin and want to thank him for a fun evening! My husband and I also dined at the bar. Food was well prepared and presented. I would recommend not orderting the cheese plate however as it was cubes of processed .. not what was expected. Super fun, super friendly and great value. Thanks and we will see you again!

title: Good but not great
text: Nice way to spend ~1/2 hr of your day getting some interesting local information. Our guide was fairly new and was still learning her routine, so I would suggest you try to arrange your trip for one of the older fellows who (as we heard from the bank as we walked) had a better routine. It is a must when you visit and with the expansion, I can only imagine how much better it will be!

title: Fresh, good but very popular
text: We had breakfast with you twice and picked up to go food twice .. all times the food was excellent! How can you go wrong when the baking is done on premise and you can see them in the kitchen as you walk toward Travis Park!! They have a big space which is always filled and we know why - great value, great quality, great coffee and great service (with many smiles) Thank you for our 4 meals!!! I would so recommend this spot but come early or be prepared to wait .. they are POPULAR and for good reason! Well done

title: The only place to go for tickets!!!
text: Wow .. so helpful, so friendly and you know they are honest! I would recommend that you only purchase tickets, seek information from this location as they are an official visitor info centre and right across the street from the Alamo. We booked the river cruise, LBJ / Hill Country Tour and got information about all the local attractions! Very helpful, no pressure and they know what they are talking about! Thank you for helping us so well! Cheers!!
place: San Antonio's Official Visitor Information Center

title: Great welcome and great time
text: We entered and were greeted warmly and shown to a table that suited us very well. The young lady who seated us has a relative in Toronto and we were happy to have had such a pleasant conversation with her! When we came back for a mid afternoon break from the heat (on a different day) she remembered us as did the manager! WOW impressive, very impressive, but now back to the review, the selections of beer are second to none and on an hot day - nothing is better! We started with the edamame before we selected our dinner and enjoyed our first draft! I had the Chicken Cobb Salad and it was really good - so fresh and well presented. My husband had the Lobster and Shrimp Agnolotti and he enjoyed it all! Delish. No room for dessert but we did have coffee, which was hot and flavourful. What a great, relaxed evening and we watched the Toronto Raptors beat the Milwaukee Bucks!! Not rushed, great service, friendly team members and a perfect location. What more could you ask for ?? I can't think...Thank you all - hope to see you again sometime!!

title: Very Good but.....
text: My husband and I were staying in a suite in the hotel and were very excited to dine at Rebelle, however our excitement soon turned a bit sour. We were seated and the female server greeted us warmly and was very friendly. The unfortunate part was that our table was in the back of the restaurant where the roof is dramatically lower and therefore the sound was amplified 10 fold. WOW was it noisy. We certainly were not going to enjoy a quite dinner! The 2 couples in the corner could be heard clear across the room!!! We started with cocktails, ordered a bottle of wine and a dozen oysters for me and the Spanish octopus for my husband. I was so disappointed that in a seafood restaurant that they DIDN'T have the skill, knowledge or bothered to make the effort to release each oyster from the shell. I was shocked that I had to do all 12 myself. The octopus was a bit chewy for his taste. We then ordered the beef filet x 2. They were cooked perfectly, the Bearnaise sauce was delicious and the side of asparagus was a perfect accompaniment. No dessert but I wanted hot tea and was told that they didn't have it? Odd because at breakfast I was able to get hot tea - do they not have the ability to share provisions, one might ponder? Regardless - I would say it was a well done meal overall, but having dined twice at Ostra (having their seafood tower both times) I would suggest Rebelle pull up their socks or have more folks dine at the competition. Sorry .. but that was our experience.

title: Great food/Great Service in a splendid location
text: What can one say about a restaurant where many of the team remember you upon a return visit! We were greeted warmly (both times) and taken to two wonderful tables where we had the pleasure of meeting Nicolas, our host for both evenings. We had cocktails to start and were left to relax and enjoy as we contemplated the menu. We decided on the TOWER of seafood - and I have to tell you - we were not disappointed! My husband ordered a lovely bottle of wine and so our culinary adventure began! Oysters, shucked perfectly, briny and firm, lobster tails that were sweet and tender, the best of the Texas Gulf Shrimps, wonderfully juicy crab claws and a ceviche that was tangy and so delicious. As we enjoyed our evenings - Nicholas was there to aid, offer friendly conversation and to keep our wine glasses filled. He was always there/but never there as he has truly mastered the art of excellent table service for his guests! We enjoyed our meal - sorry I can't tell you about the desserts as we had no room left - the portions were very generous and so very very good! Coffee to follow and we left having had a wonderful dining experience. I would truly recommend this restaurant for anyone - yes on the pricey side however with amazing seafood/great service and quality surroundings one should expect to be pampered and pleased and my goodness - we where! Special thanks to Nicholas for his considerate, friendly and very efficient service. Hope to see you again one day!
place: Ostra at Mokara Hotel and Spa

title: Best Lunch spot in town
text: What more can be said, generous portions, great selection, fresh, quality and quick. I hear it was recently purchased, so let's hope the new ownership keep this standard. Great subs - SOOO much better than the chains, burgers, salads and burgers. A must for a hunger person at lunch or dinner. Subs are big enough to share and be full!

title: Fun, light and Continental
text: This is a 'sharing' restaurant! The service was excellent, the young man who was our server knew his stuff. We ordered a 'bottle' not the house wine, his pouring skills were excellent. He took the time to explain the concept, how to order and was very kind. I would HIGHLY recommend this restaurant for couples! This is an adults only restaurant! The food was beautifully presented and delicious. A MUST if you stay here or at one of the associated properties! Thank you for a lovely evening - can't wait to come back next year.

title: Rouge the next Ryanair
text:
What can I say...it was cramped, uncomfortable and barely enough room for the flight attendants to get the carts down the aisle. The trip home found the cabin too warm with no fix, hard seats and no menu in my pocket. The flight was smooth, despite the inclement weather so thank you to the pilots. It was a turn around and not well cleaned for the return. No amenities are offered, couldn't book the business class (which we wanted), no entertainment and the space behind the seat where the video used to be is now used by inconsiderate passengers for their garbage! Also, we had many folks with connecting OVS destinations - MAKE AN ANNOUNCEMENT and TELL people to sit down (because you have identified those that need to get off) so that they can .. as usual the less experienced travelers JUMPED UP and blocked the aisles. This can be avoided if your Flight team handle the situation but we had what appeared to be 'quite' attendants that couldn't handle the situation.
I would like to say to Air Canada - DO NOT push these planes for flights on your overseas routes because if you do your improved reputation will be DESTROYED. Was that fight not enough to show you that passengers opinions matter? Rouge is Sub Par and would make me consider NOT using AC Vacations to book my holiday.

title: Something to see......
text: Well .. it is a site to see for sure but if you are wanting to be shocked or surprised...keep walking. It really is pretty tame, people doing their jobs...that's basically it. No pictures please - be respectful. Interesting but not a MUST...

title: Location is everything
text: This hotel is in an amazing spot - short walk to Anne Frank House, Jewish Quarter, Rembrandt House, red light district, the Palace or the Diamonds are Forever bridge! Check-in was fine. We were told that we had a 'butler' who introduced himself and then showed us to our suite. We paid for a room which we didn't occupy from the previous day, so we could (due to an horrible flight departure from our previous location) shower, breakfast and rest but we had to the floor staff open our door and say oh you haven't checked out yet? Well if we paid for the room - it should have been empty and recorded on the house keeping log? The suite was over looking the canal on the top floor - very nice. Well appointed with a wonderful bathroom. The only draw back is that there is really NO where to unpack? What happened to the dresser? or a bed side table with a drawer? If you are staying more than 2 days and have more luggage - good luck unpacking! Strange trend which I hope will be reversed. The breakfast selection was generous but staff could use a lesson in customer service .. they are SLOW!! We over heard one guest say he had been waiting 30 minutes and he was annoyed and rightfully so. We had excellent service but we were not in a rush (thank goodness) The bar was great, the bar tender was friendly and mixed a great martini! Bridges BarBistro was delicious. Fun concept for nibblers/finger food. Great visit .. thank you

title: Walking in the footsteps of Christ
text: It is hard not to be captivated by the history of this route. To think that a man was forced to carry a cross on his back to his death and that this route is still there? It is part of the great old city of Jerusalem....you must do this!
place: The Way of the Cross - Via Dolorosa

title: Tombs, history and rememberance
text: The mount has been used as a Jewish cemetery for over 3,000 years and holds approximately 150,000 graves with many historically significant individuals burried there. It offers a magnificent view of the old city and is well worth a stop on your tour.

title: Holy of Holy
text: For believers this is a must visit for visiters to Jerusalem it is a place to see. It is so hot there and no shade but really it is more an active religious site and therefore needs to be treated with respect.

title: Walk of history
text: It is hard to belive that this was Jerusalem's main street 1500 years ago. It is amazing and again a must see...have a guide take you and you will be granted even greater insite to this amazing route.

title: Dead Sea Scrolls
text: It is a miracle that they survived as The Dead Sea Scrolls were most likely written by the Essenes during the period from about 200 B.C. to 68 C.E./A.D. It is just one of the wonders you will see at the Israel Museum. Please make the time and visit the museum and the scrolls.

title: We must never forget
text: What a stark and horrific reminder of the inhuman treatment we can inflict upon one another. This is a place to honour and remember those who were murdered in such a gruesome fashion. Please you must see this so that we can all work together to ensure we never repeat any aspect of this horror.
place: Yad Vashem - The World Holocaust Remembrance Center

title: Church of the Holy Sepulchre - what more is there to say
text: It is an amazing place, dimly light so let your eyes adjust but once they do be prepared to be amazed. You might even be lucky enjoy to see the gentleman whose family have been keeper of the keys to the door for over 700 years sitting on his bench. It is a wonder, believer or not you can't not be overcome with the spirituality of this building. To see three different Christian faiths working together in harmony to keep and care for the tomb and site of the crucifixion of Jesus of Nazareth. If you are able, have a guide take you through as they will share more of the details! A must see place.

title: Quick trip
text: You are greeted warmly as you walk to the desk for check-in. Efficient and friendly service and welcome cookies as you get your room key, thanks to Tom. Room was large, clean, well-appointed and had a wonderfully large shower with a good shower head! You couldn't hear other voices through the walls so it was lovely and quite for sleep. The Parkway Prime Bar was well stocked and both Erica and Warren are excellent bar tenders who will ensure your needs are met! It is a short walk to the Casino, should you chose to dine there and not wish to drink/drive. We have stayed in many of the hotels in this area and this is by far the best and will be our new GO TO Hotel.
place: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Niagara Falls New York

title: Exceptional
text: We had 4 dinners in this restaruant and enjoyed them all! Service - EXCELLENT, Food - EXCELLENT, Enjoyment - EXCELLENT. Please take the time to make a reservation and enjoy this gem, a true jewel in the crown for this wonderful hotel. Amazing and value for money.
place: La Regence - Kosher Fine Dining Restaurant

title: Best hotel in Jerusalem
text: You simply cannot go wrong with this hotel. It is by far and away the best in the city. Service, support, views and food - EXCELLENT. La Regence was exceptional - if you would like to enjoy a relaxed, special and delicious meal, look no further .. Ariel will take excellent care of your party. He made our dining special. We laughed and smiled and enjoyed! Hotel is rich in history, the location is second to none, the care and attention are evident and they team make your visit memorable! What a wonderful place indeed. We hope to return, soon! Thank you all for an exceptional experience.

title: International City of Tel Avivi
text: This location is simply perfect. Right on the Mediterranean and the harbour you have the wonderful scent of sea air. Check in was efficient and personal. Rooms are just as the pictures show – comfortable and spacious. Get the included breakfast as it is a feast! Pool was relaxing and the view boundless! Not a city for a long stay but for a comfortable one please select this hotel – you won’t regret it! We didn’t!!

title: Great Food and wonderful service
text:
Please come to Betty's .. best fish & chips but more importantly ...the best team of people at this establishment! Great food, PIES speciality but most important is the value for money and they way you are treated .. 5 stars to the team there!! You are the best.
A must go to .. great food, great value and wonderful service. Thanks

title: Spectacular Resort
text: Wow, a luxury resort to be sure. Location is wonderful. Property is wonderful, hospitality, service and support all top notch, as you would expect from a Fairmont property. We were greeted, luggage loaded to a wagon and escorted to the check in desk. A short wait was enhanced by a welcome beverage, leis and smiles. Check in was prompt, friendly and efficient and we were take to our suite immediately. A smart design, fantastic amenities and comfort helped you to enjoy your time in the suite but the real joy came from the location, pools, beach, restaurants and services. There is nothing you couldn’t do or enjoy. Dinner at Nick’s Fish Market was a perfect. A table overlooking the water, well timed and thoughtful service made my birthday dinner very special indeed. Caffe Ciao Bakery and Market was super convenient and a great alternative for a quick snack or meal! Golf close by, shopping a walk or a courtesy drive away you have so much to do and see! Book in advance and get the full benefit of everything this resort and it’s wonderful team of Fairmont Ambassadors can provide. A gem in the crown for sure.

title: Lovely setting with superb service
text: A birthday celebration with a twist. Sadly my husband was under the weather but I enjoyed my dinner solo. I was warmly greeted with birthday wishes and then shown to our reserved table overlooking the pacific and grounds of the hotel. I indicated that I was not in a rush and the service was excellent! Martini to savor with the view then I orders the oysters - another 1/2 dozen to follow and then the fresh fish all washed down with a half bottle of french wine. The food was, as expected presented beautifully and delicious what I would like to highlight was the wonderful service I received as a single woman. To some this may not seem like a note worthy point but as a business woman who has dined alone, I wanted to congratulate the team who helped me to enjoy my dinner in-spite of knowing that my husband was suffering from flu in our suite. Thank you for your care and consideration and a lovely and most memorable dinner

title: Great alternative
text: What can you say about a well run, multi faceted facility that will offer hot/cold/warm breakfast/lunch/dinner, beverages alcoholic and non, cookies/cakes and treats as well as salads or life necessities like flu medicine. Great team, friendly and helpful support! A wonderful option

title: Hooray for Hollywood
text: We were greeted so warmly by text, due to the late hour of our arrival at the airport, and again when we arrived by the bell and front desk staff. Check in was quick and efficient and we arrived to a comforting and well-appointed room. If I had to find something to comment upon, it would be the tissues in the bathroom - one ply. A lovely corner room which was very comfortable was our ‘home’ for the 4 nights. Location is great to see Universal and Warner Brother's studio. Free Shuttle to Universal and a $15-20 cab ride to Warner Brothers. Excellent! Breakfast is amazing and I know why they are famous for their Steak/Seafood Buffet - make a reservation!! Would highly recommend this property and the team of folks there who will support your visit! Great brand ambassadors Hilton! Well done.

title: Paradise Lost?
text: What should have been the highlight of our trip turned out to be an huge disappointment. Some of that can't be shouldered by the resort as Sunday was torrential rain and flooding however the resort's reaction to that natural occurrence was an unmitigated FAIL. Check in was friendly and efficient, the room, is just as the pictures show, perfect then - unpacking and getting ready for our dinner at Pa'akai, the safe batteries failed with all our items locked inside. Security had to break it open and replace it but the black grease and mess from that activity were never cleaned up .. so that closet became unusable. The Bell man, in an attempt to help no doubt, turned the temperature in the fridge to the highest setting (unbeknownst to us) and the glass water bottle they provide you with froze and shattered. I cleaned up the glass shards, left a note for housekeeping but no thanks for the warning or another bottle were provided. The dinner was perfect, food delicious and service top notch, expensive but it was expected, what wasn't was people wearing flip flops or baseball caps for fine dining. Then Saturday am, round of golf - terrific, sunning by the pool and a great dinner at Lei Lei's. Great food, good value and friendly service! Then the rains came and Sunday was a blow out...everything cancelled - not the resorts fault however the main building has NO lunch facilities (save a snack bar) and with the pool restaurant/bar flooded, the beach restaurant unreachable due to weather and the golf course again unreachable due to weather - what did the resort do? Not much really - what should have been a preplanned and executable alternative was fumbled. What should have happened was that the KULA GRILLE should have been immediately reopened, staffed and lunch service should have been supported, what did happen was a mess. I would recommend a look, but unless you are 100% outdoor related or have 100% perfect weather ... give this a pass until they learn to execute a plan.

title: Pre show dinner and so much more....
text: Great service and a wonderful dinner await you. We started with a lovely bottle of wine and then ordered our seafood tower which is served not as you would think in a tiered platter but in a beautiful sculpture placed in the centre of our table. As you can imagine it was a site to behold but even more importantly the seafood was cooked properly and was delicious. We had 1/2 lobster, crab, oysters, shrimp, mussels and clams. We tucked in and every so often a wonderful member of staff would top up our wine glasses and ask if we required anything. We had a lovely time. We ended with a Caesar salad which was well presented with real bacon and parmesan - which you would expect! We shall return most definitely. There is a dress code and the prices are as you would expect so make an evening of it - dress up, relax and enjoy a great meal and wonderful service!

title: It IS a market...
text: St Lawrence Market is just what it claims to be a market. It is a vast covered building, bustling and busy with shops and shoppers. Fresh fruits, vegetables, baking, cheeses, wonderful fresh fish, glorious meats and speciality items abound. The prices are competitive but not inexpensive. If you are out for a wander on Front St. it is worth a visit. Be sure to purchase one of the best back bacon sandwiches in the city - you get them there!!!

title: Ladies Luncheon
text: Seated promptly and with courtesy, smiles, menus, ice water and complementary chips and dip. We were given the perfect amount of time to visit before we were asked for our orders. Sara our server, was efficient and friendly and was quick to refill water/coffees. My salad - Mr. Hamilton's Lentils was very good but sadly it was missing the feta crumble which I realize too late to ask for a correction but I would suggest that the kitchen take greater care. The 3 other ladies seemed to enjoy their lunches also and I must add that the did look tasty! We had a lovely time and overall I would recommend this place for good/prompt service. Thanks to Sara for giving us space to visit.

title: Memorial Weekend in NYC
text: If you want to be close to Times Square and theatres this hotel is for you. If you don't like crowds don't stay here. The check-in is quick and efficient. Rooms are spacious and comfortable but no free Wi-Fi unless you have a 'status' in your rewards membership or you are in the lobby or fitness centre - you can pay for it if you chose. Over all and where it is most important is your team and they were all outstanding. Check-in, Concierge, Restaurant and Bar team members all very good. Friendly service with a smile but your most outstanding team member for us was the doorman helping with cabs - he had the biggest smile and was a true ambassador for your hotel. I would recommend this hotel for it's location/proximity to theatres and also advise that you will be paying for that convenience. I would say that choice is subjective so depending your needs/wants this could be a good choice for your visit to NYC.

title: 1 Night stop over
text: Great location if you are shopping at the Fashions Outlet Mall! Check-in was quick and efficient and they offer a good breakfast as part of the room deal. Rooms were comfortable and there is an indoor pool for those who would wish to swim. I would recommend for families and for a stop over. Good value for a clean/safe and friendly hotel.

title: Great Food and Friendly Service
text: This was our second but not last dinner at El Cubilete and it was terrific. They provide you with nacho chips and salsa while you are looking at the menu. We chose tacos and fajata and they were delicious. Food is always hot and fresh. There is no push to turn the table and you can take what you don't eat home with you. Great place - love it

title: Athentic Mexican North of the Boarder
text: Simple menu but taste is what counts and the flavour is there in spades. This is a take out place but the food is made to order - hot and fresh every time! I would highly recommend the Pork Tacos which my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed along with a side of rice / beans (1 order is good for 2) and chips/salsa. We have found our new spot for a yummy taste of Mexico....thanks! They also offer some dim sum so we will have to try that another time.
